snippet: The divisions have marked Cairo’s geography, with the pro-military and pro-Morsi camps occupying different squares, blocking traffic, erecting tents and rigging up loudspeakers.
abstract: Egyptian military’s early-morning assault that left at least 54 Islamist protesters dead appears to be intensifying the scarring arguments and growing divisions among its citizens about who should be ruling the country and who is responsible for its plunge into turmoil.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and KAREEM FAHIM

lead_paragraph: The divisions have marked Cairo’s geography, with the pro-military and pro-Morsi camps occupying different squares, blocking traffic, erecting tents and rigging up loudspeakers.

headline.main: Bloody Day in Unrest Widens the Rupture Among Ordinary Egyptians
headline.print_headline: Bloody Day in Unrest Deepens the Rupture Among Ordinary Egyptians

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
